snippet: The accord will resolve federal charges that the drugstore chain failed to properly monitor the sales of controlled drugs at some of its outlets.
abstract: Walgreen Co, nation's biggest pharmacy operator, agrees to pay $80 million fine to Drug Enforcement Agency to resolve federal charges it failed to properly control sales of narcotic painkillers at some of its outlets; DEA says many of drugs dispensed at Florida facility made their way to black market.
lead_paragraph: The accord will resolve federal charges that the drugstore chain failed to properly monitor the sales of controlled drugs at some of its outlets.

headline.seo: Walgreen to Pay $80 Million for Lax Control of Painkillers
headline.main: Walgreen to Pay $80 Million Fine in D.E.A. Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Chain to Pay $80 Million In Drug Fine
